oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Colt Model 1860 Revolver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1860 Colt revolver found at Fort Hill near Humboldt, Tennessee. There was a skirmish at the site during the war. The Colt "Army" was utilized extensivley throughout the war by both sides. The term "Army" in refernce to pistols of the era indicates a .44 caliber weapon. The pistol is six shot and each chamber is loaded with a charge of powder and a bullet. The powder is ignited by placing percussion caps on each cylinder. The caps ignite the powder when struck by the hammer.
